meanings.definition: To lift or move to a higher position
meanings.sent1: She raised her hand in class to answer the question.
meanings.sent2: He raised the flag up the pole.
meanings.sent3: The cat raised its paw to bat at the toy.
meanings.sent4: The sun raised higher in the sky as the day went on.
meanings.sent5: The crane raised the heavy load effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To cause to grow or develop
meanings.sent1: Watering the plants regularly raised their height.
meanings.sent2: Good nutrition can raise a child's overall health.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion raised the tiny seed into a giant tree overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement raised his confidence to new levels.
meanings.sent5: Reading books can raise your knowledge and imagination.

meanings.definition: To increase in amount or level
meanings.sent1: The price of the house raised significantly after the renovations.
meanings.sent2: The temperature raised by ten degrees in just an hour.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room raised as the concert started.
meanings.sent4: His hard work raised his grades from a C to an A.
meanings.sent5: The noise level raised as more people joined the party.

meanings.sent1: She raised her children with love and care.
meanings.sent2: The orphanage raised many children who found loving families.
meanings.sent3: The farmer raised a herd of cows on his land.
meanings.sent4: The teacher raised important topics during the class discussion.
meanings.sent5: The mentor raised the young artist to fame with guidance.

meanings.sent1: The workers raised the new building in record time.
meanings.sent2: They raised a barn for the community to use.
meanings.sent3: The team raised a monument in memory of their victory.
meanings.sent4: The architect raised a beautiful structure that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The volunteers raised a shelter for the homeless in the city.

meanings.sent1: The charity event raised thousands of dollars for the cause.
meanings.sent2: They raised enough money to support the local school.
meanings.sent3: The bake sale raised funds for the animal shelter.
meanings.sent4: The community raised donations for the disaster relief efforts.
meanings.sent5: The marathon raised awareness and funds for cancer research.

meanings.definition: To elevate in rank or status
meanings.sent1: His hard work and dedication raised him to the position of manager.
meanings.sent2: The promotion raised her status within the company.
meanings.sent3: The award ceremony raised the athletes to national recognition.
meanings.sent4: The successful project raised the team's reputation in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The royal decree raised the knight to the title of baron.
